title: The Masked Singer judge Lindsay Lohan fails during Aussie slang quiz
text:
She did plenty of research on Australian celebrities before joining the judging panel of The Masked Singer.

But Lindsay Lohan's knowledge of local slang still leaves much to be desired.

The American actress, 33, tried to guess the meanings of popular Aussie colloquialisms in a hilarious video shared by 10 Play.

'Avo means to advocate?' The Masked Singer judge Lindsay Lohan (pictured) made hilarious guesses during an Australian slang challenge this week

In the clip, the Mean Girls star was baffled by terms such as 'fair dinkum' (fair, true or reasonable), 'servo' (service station), 'chook' (chicken) and 'avo' (avocado).

When asked what 'fair dinkum' meant, Lindsay replied: 'A ferret? Sounds a little German though... or Swiss-German.'

Lindsay also incorrectly guessed that 'servo' meant 'to serve someone'.

Stumped! Lindsay was baffled by terms such as 'fair dinkum' (fair, true or reasonable), 'servo' (service station), 'chook' (chicken) and 'avo' (avocado)

She burst out laughing when she learned the real definition, saying: 'Oh, for like getting petrol? Like a gas station?'

Lindsay then speculated that 'chook' meant to be 'just done' - as in tired or fed up.

When the actual meaning was revealed, she said: 'Oh! Oh, my gosh. Where do you guys come up with these things?'

Oh, dear! Lindsay incorrectly guessed that 'servo' meant 'to serve someone'. Pictured on The Masked Singer with fellow judge Dave Hughes (right)

Surprisingly, Lindsay was stumped by 'avo', which is simply an abbreviation of avocado. She believed it was a verb meaning 'to advocate'.

'Wagging' was the next word, which of course means to skip school.

'That sounds like something I shouldn't say out loud... like getting it on!' she cheekily replied, referring to sexual activity.

The Masked Singer continues Monday at 7:30pm on Channel 10
description: She did plenty of research on Australian celebrities before joining the judging panel of The Masked Singer - but Lindsay Lohan's knowledge of local slang still leaves much to be desired
authors: Shive Prema For Daily Mail Australia
